intro: Verbascum rupicola, commonly known as the rock mullein, is a perennial plant native to the rocky and arid regions of southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
